Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a light brown pottery ribbed vessel, interior spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a pale red-brown slip and with remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.174)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36395) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36395)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 252 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13441 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
